STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 11, 2021
Leo Giori Jr
Iosco/Alcona County DHHS
2145 E Huron Road
East Tawas, MI 48730
RE: License #: CP350201199
Iosco/Alcona County DHHS
2145 E Huron Road
East Tawas, MI 48730
Dear Mr. Giori Jr:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 10/08/2021.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• For repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not achieve
compliance.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)552-3662.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(4) An agency shall document placement specifications
consistent with the information contained in the
reevaluation. The placement specifications shall include all
of the following:
(a) Age,
One of the three current foster home files reviewed contained an evaluation report
that did not include the age range of children who would be appropriate for
placement. The date of this evaluation was 07/14/2021 and the corresponding
license (3706) indicated an age range of 0-5 years.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(7) If any violations are cited and there is a signed
corrective action plan, all social service workers who have
children placed in the home shall be notified there is a
corrective action plan and what is required of the foster
parent in that plan.
One of the three special evaluations reviewed included a noncompliance that
required a corrective action plan. Documentation that the foster care worker who
had children placed in this home was notified of the expectations included in the
corrective action plan was not located/confirmed. The intake for this special
evaluation was dated 10/30/2020.
3

R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(4) If an emergency change in placement is necessary, then
all of the documentation required in subrules (2) and (3) of
this rule shall be in the child's record within 14 calendar
days after the change in placement.
One of the three current foster child records reviewed indicated the foster child had a
change in placement 06/10/2021 that was not documented as required by this rule
until 08/13/2021.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and
at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
One of the three current foster child records reviewed included an updated service
plan that was not completed within the time frame required by this rule. In this file
the report ending date was10/19/2020 and the corresponding updated service plan
was dated 10/27/2020. Repeat violation established (previously cited in
renewal evaluation completed 08/26/2020. CAP approved 08/31/2020.
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following
information and documentation, which shall be recorded
within 30 calendar days after placement in independent
living and updated at least once every 90 calendar days:
(n) Change of placement documentation as required by
R 400.12405.
The one current independent living record reviewed indicated the youth had a
change in placement on 05/24/2021 and 07/26/2021 and the documentation for each
of these changes was completed 08/30/2021. The documentation would have been
due 06/07/2021 and 08/09/2021 respectively.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
4

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
No technical assistance was required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Documentation of changes in placement.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period for the renewal evaluation completed
08/26/2020. Areas identified as a part of the renewal evaluation were R 400.12310
(4)(a), R 400.12324 (8), R 400.12327 (5)(d), R 400.12327 (6)(c), R 400.12418 (2)(b)
and FOM 722-05. The only area identified as a repeat violation as a part of this
interim review is R 400.12418 (2)(b).
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator report primarily dealt with reviewing citations, corrective
action plans, staffing issues, and the impact/effect of COVID related issues in the
provision of services to children and families.
Interviews
Twelve foster care services related staff participated in entrance and exit
conferences. No significant concerns were noted.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The DCWL Analyst identified one safety concern as follows:
Safety Alert: One unlicensed relative had a creek behind the house and the home
did not have any door alarms.
Resolution: The safety alert was resolved 06/30/2021 when door alarms were
provided to the caregiver. They were confirmed as installed and utilized by visits at
the home since. Pictures were also provided of the backyard area. The signed
resolution has been submitted for ISEP placement.
5

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
10/11/2021
________________________________________
Mark R. Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
October 11, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
